definition[0]: the way in which someone does a job or deals with a situation, problem, or person
example[0]: Such a situation needs very careful handling.
example[1]: The president has been much criticized for his handling of the crisis.
example[2]: The equipment should be able to withstand a certain amount of rough handling.
definition[2]: the act of buying, selling, or moving goods
example[4]: A special licence is required for the manufacture or handling of any dangerous chemical.
definition[3]: the way in which a vehicle can be controlled, especially how easy it is for a driver to control it
example[5]: It’s a lovely little car – the ride is comfortable and the handling excellent.
definition[4]: the way in which a problem, situation, or person is dealt with
example[6]: He is charged with securities fraud in the handling of his clients’ accounts.
example[7]: Inept handling of sackings is bad not just for those dismissed but for the employer as well.
definition[5]: when goods etc are moved from one place to another
example[8]: The environmental unit deals with waste handling and clean-up.
